intro: Onobroma flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered candlewood, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and woody, shrub-like structure. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration efforts.
